context: Kolme is the Finnish word for 'three'. It's a cardinal number and belongs to the group of Finnish numbers. The word declines depending on its grammatical case, as shown in the provided dictionary definition. For example, 'kolmen' means 'of three' (genitive case), while 'kolmea' means 'three' (partitive case).  The plural form is 'kolmet'. It can also be used to express quantities and time periods.
